Author: t1#9168
Content:
Hello,
I tried to create an asset chain and run my two nodes. 
Working fine, but then I decided to stop the node 2 (mining) at block 54. 
I restarted the node after having added -addressindex=1 in the command. 
The node restarted to mine from block 1. why not from block 55?
And how can we check that both nodes are on the same chain (or taht node 2 has not split)?
Thank you!

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`The node restarted to mine from block 1. why not from block 55?`
because you told it to generate blocks before syncing it to the other node

Author: t1#9168
Content: Thank you! Thus I have to restart the node with the  same long command without the -gen ?

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: yes, only use -gen when you're certain to connect

Author: t1#9168
Content: When the node is sync, I do a ./komodod -gen?

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`./komodo-cli -ac_name=WHATEVERCHAIN setgenerate true 1`
the number being how many CPU threads

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: `./komodo-cli -ac_name=WHATEVERCHAIN setgenerate false` will stop mining

Author: t1#9168
Content: excellent thank you

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @t1 yes, the docs say use `-gen` but it's safer to use `setgenerate` after the daemon is loaded

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @t1 also, when you add an index, it must reindex from block 1, it sounds like that is what you saw

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: changing any index, adding or removing, will trigger a full reindex

Author: t1#9168
Content:
Hello,
I am trying a 100% POS, and I used the pos64staker. 
until block 100 all ok: "mined block combined to ..." but from block 100 (end of mining)  I only get invalid blocks...

Author: t1#9168
Content:
Ok it seems that all my 64 addresses are not staking because of being immature. 
Per default, how many blocks to have the maturity?

Author: t1#9168
Content:
I guess it is 100. 
Ok now I got staking working, using mature coins.

Author: t1#9168
Content: And my remaining question is.... why staking is using 100% of the CPU? (having setgenerate true 0)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It just does, when there are no utxo eligible it won't use any CPU

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Still has to calculate an equihash solution for the block header even though its at zero diff that's not free.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @t1 funds in block 1 become mature in block 101

Author: t1#9168
Content:
Thanks for your inputs!
And should I worry about this "error" 
"chain tip changed during staking "

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @t1 that is a pos-specific warning/error, I have never seen it, but my guess is @blackjok3r or @Alright knows what it means

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it sounds like a new block came in, and the staking algo had to restart

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but I don't know anything about that pos64 stuff

Author: t1#9168
Content: Thanks. Wondering if it is due to the fact that I have only 1 CPU

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It means a block arrived so unreset the staking loop yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Before I fixed that you would keep trying to stake an invalid block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Wasting CPU

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Alright can you tell me how to create an asset chain using a single node instead of two? I am going to document it this time üòÖ 
I assume one of the nodes need to change data dir, p2p and rpc ports, how to do that?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang custom p2p/rpc ports, and -datadir

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang you can do it via CLI args or put it in the conf, or a combination

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
`./komodod -datadir=$HOME/TICKER/`
```bash
# Inside $HOME/TICKER/TICKER.conf
rpcport=something_otherthan_default
p2pport=something_otherthan_default
```
this should work?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if those the correct config keys, yes, I think one may be `port`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you will also need to tell the other node how to connect to the nonstandard ports of the other node

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: run the seed node on normal params

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and make the mining node run on diff p2p/rpc ports, and have it connect to the standard ports of seed node

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is less configuration

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: other possibilities exist, I am trying to describe the "easiest to setup" and "less likely to maim people with strange bugs" way

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then you can `addnode=localhost` on the mining node

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
port in place of p2pport
> and have it connect to the standard ports of seed node
by specifying the port in the -addnode arg of the first node?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the mining node with do `-addnode=localhost` , because the seed node is also on localhost

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not sure if localhost is a default, and maybe specifying port like -addnode=localhost:port is better, not sure.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: how to let the first node know about the non standard p2p port of the minimg node?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: doing it on one node, strange bugs will most likely be run into

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang mining node connects to seed node, not the other way around

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: by giving `addnode` to the mining node, that tells it where to find the seed node

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: both have addnode in their launch?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and then they are connected

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: no, both don't, but both could

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: mining node must addnode the seednode

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: got it, let me try

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it might be possible that you could do "seednode adds mining node" but I always do vice-versa. One must know about the other, somehow

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: thanks @dukeleto , its working. Will document the exact steps followed and post it here
